result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha V. BIES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Stipulation and Order Granting Furlough
The court orders that Defendant is granted a furlough from the sentences imposed in the above-captioned cases begining at 8:00 a.m. on June 15, 2016 and concluding at 8:30 a.m. on June 20, 2016. Upon conclusion of the furlough, defendant will report to the electronic monitoring program representative in Sheboygan.

Court orders defendant to submit DNA sample.  Court orders defendant's bail revoked.

Minutes.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 06-25-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-14-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with Festival Foods.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
